name: simplify
description: Analyze source code complexity and get AI fix instructions for the most complex files. This tool runs ahma_simplify to identify files with high cognitive/cyclomatic complexity, low maintainability, or excessive size, then returns a detailed report with per-function hotspots and actionable refactoring instructions. Always pass ai_fix set to the issue number you want to fix (1 = most complex file). The report identifies specific hotspot functions within each file. The structured prompt instructs you to focus changes on those hotspots only.

subcommand.name: default
subcommand.description: Run code simplicity analysis and return fix instructions for the Nth most complex file. Set ai_fix to the issue number (1 = worst file).

positional_args.name: directory
positional_args.description: Directory to analyze (absolute or relative path to the project root)

options.name: ai-fix
options.description: Issue number to generate AI fix instructions for (1 = most complex file, 2 = second most complex, etc.). When set, outputs the full report plus a structured prompt to simplify that file.

options.name: limit
options.description: Number of top complexity issues to include in the report (default: 10)

options.name: html
options.description: Generate HTML report and open it automatically (shorthand for --html and --open combined)

options.name: extensions
options.description: File extensions to analyze as comma-separated values (e.g. rs,py,js). Supported: rs, py, js, ts, tsx, c, h, cpp, cc, hpp, hh, cs, java, go, css, html. Default: all supported extensions

options.name: verify
options.description: Re-analyze a specific file and compare against the previous analysis baseline. Shows before/after metrics with relative improvement percentages. Requires a prior full analysis run.

install_instructions: Build with: cargo build -p ahma_simplify --release && cargo install --path ahma_simplify
